questions.question_text: In handling computer-related incidents, which IT role should be responsible for recovery, containment, and prevention to constituents?

discussion.content: I see containment, I would assume Security Admin is involved. Can see due to Recovery and Prevention of constituents that Networking would be involved

choices.A: with the hard drive removed from the suspect PC, check the date and time in the system's CMOS
choices.B: with the hard drive in the suspect PC, check the date and time in the File Allocation Table
choices.C: with the hard drive removed from the suspect PC, check the date and time in the system's RAM
choices.D: with the hard drive in the suspect PC, check the date and time in the system's CMOS

discussion.content:
The answer should be D. 
Removing the hard drive before checking the CMOS settings can potentially alter the system state and might affect the investigation. Besides, to get an accurate read of the time settings as they relate to file timestamps, it's important to check them in their current state.

questions.question_text: Which is a standard procedure to perform during all computer forensics investigations?

choices.D: The gateway will be the IP used to manage the access point
choices.B: The gateway will be the IP of the attacker computer
choices.A: The gateway will be the IP of the proxy server used by the attacker to launch the attack
choices.C: The gateway will be the IP used to manage the RADIUS server

questions.question_text: Why would you need to find out the gateway of a device when investigating a wireless attack?

comments.content: OK. But ... if an alternative match to a hypothesis, even in just one part, so... , in the logical analysis, it is true.

discussion.content: This is not necessarily true as APs can have dedicated management ports which would make the ip to manage the device different than the gateway or router ip.

choices.B: The files have been marked for deletion
choices.C: The files are corrupt and cannot be recovered
choices.A: The files have been marked as hidden
choices.D: The files have been marked as read-only

discussion.content:
The OS replaces the first letter of a deleted file name with a hex byte code: E5h
E5h is a special tag that indicates that the file has been deleted
The corresponding cluster of that file in FAT is marked as unused, although it will continue to contain the information until it is overwritten

questions.question_text: While searching through a computer under investigation, you discover numerous files that appear to have had the first letter of the file name replaced by the hex code byte 5h. What does this indicate on the computer?
